man renice will give you some info; do you understand how nice values work?
but how can i change priorities in terminal?
the higher the nice value, the lower the priority (ie. the program is 'nicer' to others)
-19 is highest priority, 19 is the lowest
non-root users cannot decrease the nice value (increase the priority) of a process
top is a fullscreen textmode prog that you can renice a process with
how can i concretely change the priority with "sudo top" for a process, let's say id 33333 ?
hit r, type the PID, and the new nice value
type the pid & hit enter that is
